label: A2B_tP6_129_ac_c-002
title: High-Temperature UP$_{2}$ Structure
comments:
At temperatures below 83$^\circ$C UP$_{2}$ transforms into its \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B_tI24_107_2abc_2ab-001}{low-temperature structure} (Gerward, 1990). 
 The atomic positions are not explicitly given in (Gerward, 1990), so we take them from the ICSD entry. 
 \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B_tP6_129_ac_c-001}{Cu$_{2}$Sb ($C38$)}, \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B_tP6_129_ac_c-002}{UP$_{2}$}, and \href{current_web_home_dir/AB2_tP6_129_c_ac-003}{LaSe$_{1.85}$} have similar AFLOW prototype labels, A2B\_tP6\_129\_ac\_c for the first two and AB2\_tP6\_129\_c\_ac for the third. They are generated by the same symmetry operations with different sets of parameters ({\tt --params}) specified in their corresponding CIF files. 
 We consider all of these to be binary forms of \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC_tP6_129_c_a_c-001}{Matlockite ($E0_{1}$)}/\href{current_web_home_dir/ABC_tP6_129_c_a_c-003}{PrOI}. 
 We somewhat arbitrarily assign \begin{itemize} \item Structures with c/a $<$ 2 to the Cu$_{2}$Sb prototype, \item Structures with 2 $<$ c/a $<$ 3 to the UP$_{2}$ prototype, and \item Structures with c/a $\approx$ 4 to the LaSe$_{1.85}$ prototype. \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 The ICSD distinction between Cu$_{2}$Sb and UP$_{2}$ is not the same as ours, and they often assign binary compounds to the ternary prototypes.
